description: The last thing SmallFoot wants to add is three columns with one image in each. One is a picture of the smorgasbord from last year, one on the snacks and one on the drinks. But since SmallFoot won't switch from one to three columns until the screen width is at least 600 pixels, the images will be smaller on bigger screens. The columns, and their images, will never be wider than 320px. This means that the images can be up to 599px on screens smaller than 600px, but never larger than 320px after that. Can you help SmallFoot one last time?
todo: coffee_small.jpg should be used on screens smaller than 320px. Use coffee_medium between 320 and 600px. On screens that is at least 600px, use coffee_small.jpg again. (Use min-width in the sizes attribute)

correct.headline: We did it!
correct.text: SmallFoot thinks this was the hardest problem he faced durning the development of this site. But thank's to you, the site is finished in time!
